articles.title: WNBA and players' union fail to reach new CBA, negotiations continue without extension
articles.summary: The WNBA and its players' union weren't able to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement by the Friday night deadline, and now the league enters a “status-quo” period with no new extension reached.  Negotiations will continue with the current CBA still in effect.  The sides have met several times this week, but are still far apart on many key issues, including salary structure and revenue-sharing.
